SAP S/4HANA Cloud, extended edition API

entry.title: Custom fields for enterprise search (SAP Cloud ERP)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

we are currently working on extending Enterprise Search in order to make our custom fields searchable across different business scenarios.

In several cases, this worked as expected. For some business objects, we were able to enable the relevant ESH_* CDS views directly within the custom field.

This then allowed us to add these fields to the corresponding search model in Manage Enterprise Search.

As a result, multiple custom fields could be successfully used in Enterprise Search.

However, we have encountered a limitation for other business scenarios. For objects such as Purchase Orders and Outbound Deliveries, no ESH_* CDS views are available. Additionally, in the Manage Enterprise Search app, the option to add custom fields to the search model is not offered for these business objects.

As a consequence, several of our custom fields cannot be made available via Enterprise Search, even though the business requirement is comparable to scenarios where this functionality is supported. This leads to an inconsistent user experience and makes it more difficult for users to efficiently find related transactions across documents.

This raises the following questions:

  • Why is Enterprise Search not supported consistently across all business scenarios in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Is there any supported workaround to make custom fields for Purchase Orders (or Outbound Deliveries) searchable via Enterprise Search?

  • Is Enterprise Search support for custom fields in Purchase Orders and Outbound Deliveries planned or currently discussed on the SAP roadmap?

Thank you very much in advance for your insights and experiences.

Best regards,
Marlene

entry.title: Purchase Order Output Time Stamp Time Zone in S4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enforces UTC timestamps on PO outputs, and conversion to a different Time Zone isn’t supported at the output level.

Is this a hard restriction? I mean, all S4 Cloud businesses will need to see UTC on their PO outputs regardless they are in Asia, Europe, Australia, Africa or Americas?

entry.title: Automatically splitting items in a PI document when the limit of 999 is exceeded - EWM Module
entry.content:
HI Team,

While creating physical inventory document in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud - EWM module, system doesn't splits the documents separately if total line exceeds 999 lines. It creates only 1 Documents which further doesn't support for counting. Right now it is only splitting based on activity area.

App :

Create Physical Inventory Document - Physical Inventory

count physical inventory - paper driven counting

In my Warehouse i want to run Annual physical inventory (Procedure : AS / AL), but in 1 activity area i have more than 10000 Handling units. When Procedure (AS/AL)  is settled it is creating 1 Document with 10000 Handing unit which further is not allowed to count.

Need help in this - how system create multiple documents automatically if lines are exceeding than 999 lines.

Regards,

Nihit

entry.title: Purpose of “Info Record Update” in Purchase Order
entry.content:
Hi All,

When creating a Purchase Order (PO) with reference to an existing Purchasing Info Record, there is an option “Update Purchasing Info Record” available in the PO.

Could someone please clarify the intended purpose of this option?
Specifically, under what scenarios will this option update the condition value in the Purchasing Info Record when the PO is created with reference to it?

In my case, even though the purchasing price was changed during PO creation and this option was selected, the condition amount in the Purchasing Info Record was not updated. Only the PO number was recorded in the Reference section.

Is this behavior by design, or are there any prerequisites or restrictions for this function to work?

Please refer to the attached screenshots for reference.
Thanks in advance.

Raina

entry.title: Auto Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Automatic Packing with Nested Handling Units in Inbound Delivery – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Nested Handling Units (HUs) mean packing one Handling Unit inside another Handling Unit.
  • For example, cartons packed into a pallet, where each carton and the pallet have their own HU number.

Step 1: Maintain Packaging Material Types. The menu path is shown in the screenshot below.

Note: I have created 2 Packaging Material types:

  • Pallet
  • Carton

 

Step 2: Define Material group for Packaging Materials

  • Created Packing Material groups for Pallet and Carton.

Step 3: Define Allowed Packaging Materials

  • Map the Packing Material Type with the Packing Material Group

  • Note - For Nested HUs, it is mandatory to cross-map Packing Material Types with Packing Material Groups.

This means:

  • Carton groups must allow pallet types, and
  • Pallet groups must allow carton types,
  • so that inner HUs can be packed into outer HUs without errors.

Step 4: Assign Number Range intervals to Packaging Material Type

  • Assign a number range to the created Packing Material Types for the respective plant and storage location.

Step 5: Created packing materials in MM01 using Material Type VERP and assign the relevant Packing Material Group and Pack. Material Type in the “Matl Grp Pack. Matls, Packing Material type” fields under the Basic Data view/Sales: General Plant data. Additionally, assign the appropriate HU Type and also created SFG Material.

In this scenario, two packing materials are created:

  • CARTONBOX with Packing Material Type CARTON
  • PALLET1 with Packing Material Type PALLET
  • 42 with SFG type.

 

Step 6:  Create Packing Instructions using T-Code: POP1

  • Please note that the Handling Unit (HU) number is generated only for the Load Carrier maintained in a Packaging Instruction.
  • As a result, to generate HUs for both cartons and pallets, each must be defined as a Load Carrier. Since a Packaging Instruction can contain only one Load Carrier, separate Packaging Instructions are required for cartons and pallets.
  • Based on this approach, the following Packaging Instructions have been created:

  • Created Packing Instruction “AutoPack”, added Components for Cotton Box.

 

  • Maintain check profile.

  • Check and save.

  • A separate Packaging Instruction is created for the pallet by adding the PALLET material as Item Category “P” and the AUTOPACK packaging instruction as Item Category “I”. Maintain the required quantities, then check and save.

Step 7: For automatic determination of the Packaging Instruction, create a condition record using T-code POF1.

  • Select “RCPT” standard for Inbound delivery.

  • Assign the SFG material and the ‘PALLET’ Packaging Instruction in the determination record.

Step 8:  Enable Auto Packing in Delivery Types

  • Selected Standard “EL” delivery type for Inbound delivery
  • Enabled “Automatic Packing” and save

The above are the configuration steps. The functional flow is explained below.

  • Created PO by selecting Confirmation key.

  • Create the inbound delivery, select the line item, and click ‘Auto Packing’. The system automatically packs the material.

In this scenario, Material 42 – SFG Material is maintained.

  • Each Carton Box is defined to carry 25 KG of SFG material.
  • Multiple Carton Boxes are then packed into a Pallet, where one pallet contains 4 carton boxes.
  • A Purchase Order is created for 100 KG of 42 SFG material.

During Inbound Delivery Auto Packing, the system performs the packing automatically as follows:

  • 100 KG of SFG material is packed into 4 Carton HUs (25 KG each).
  • These 4 Carton HUs are nested and packed into 1 Pallet HU.

This demonstrates Nested Handling Unit (HU) auto packing, where inner Carton HUs are packed into an outer Pallet HU, and each level is assigned its own HU number automatically by the system.

entry.title: Receive linked Projects with Master Projects via API HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Team,

For a custom development, I need to fetch master project together with their linked projects.

We tried APIs provided by communication scenario Commercial Project Integration (Commercial Project Integration ) however not receiving required information. I am only able to check if the project is Master project. 

Could you please suggests us how to retrieve master projects along with  it's linked  projects.

 

I would really appreciate your help.

Thanks,

Namrata Chaudhari

entry.title: S4HANA Public Projects - WBS vs WOs
entry.content:
For all our investment projects we use WOs underneath WBS. Initially we considered to use WBSs only but that does not work for our daily reality because of :

- project Aps projects are very limited (lack necessary grain) and have several bugs. Maintenance (EAM) apps e.g. Maintenance act/plan, manage planning buckets more mature/grain. 

- as per design apparently can only be routed to project mgr at project def. we have large multi million/discipline projects with delegated budgetholderships which are defined in WBS hierarchy. 

3 questions

- how do others with large multi disciplinairy projects cope with this? Also WOs or still all in on WBSs only? Custom fields with Extensibility?

- we have 3 WBS levels below project def. Is that the max as per design or can this be expanded?

- SE approval routing. Anyone found a way to stick to best practise/clean core but route to delegated budgetholders at WBS level? Splitting project defs we have considered but does not make sense in our view. 

Keen to hear other's views from the daily reality and of course @Chris73 's expert views

entry.title: How to achieve WOCR scenario where one Warehouse Order picks only fixed storage type and another pic
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a scenario in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud EWM where I need to configure Warehouse Order Creation Rules (WOCR) such that:

  • Warehouse Order 1 → Should pick tasks only from Fixed Storage Type.
  • Warehouse Order 2 → Should pick tasks from all other storage types except Fixed Storage Type.

Could you please guide me on how to achieve this?

  • Is it possible to use WOCR filters for this scenario?
  • How should priorities and sorting be configured?
  • Any best practices or limitations in Public Cloud?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: How to change the FYV in Make Company Code Seeting - Asset Accounting Specific
entry.content:
In the current Fiscal Year Variant config, under Specify Primary Finance Setting, it was configured as SZ - Configurable Template Variant. And this is good.

 

However, 2 company codes are required to use K4 as a fiscal year variant in Make Company Code Setting - Asset Accounting Specific.

Are there any ways for this company code to be assigned to K4 instead of SZ?

entry.title: German Withholding Tax (Bauabzugsteuer)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently working on a project requiring the implementation of the German Construction Withholding Tax (Bauabzugsteuer), specifically under Sections 48-48d of the German Income Tax Act (EStG).

We are using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I am looking for guidance from anyone who has implemented this specific localization requirement in a public cloud environment. Specifically, I have the following questions:

  • Framework: Can the standard Extended Withholding Tax (WHT) framework be used to meet these legal requirements in the Public Cloud, or is there a specific localized solution/scope item?

  • Documentation: Are there specific Best Practices (Scope Items) or configuration guides available for this localization? I have checked the SAP Help Portal but would appreciate any pointers to specific "Bauabzugsteuer" documentation for Cloud.

  • Reporting: How are you handling the automated reporting and notifications to the tax authorities? Is this covered via the Advanced Compliance Reporting (ACR) / SAP Statutory Reporting framework?

If you have tackled this before or have any documentation/tips to share, I would be very grateful for your insights.

Thanks in advance!
